content: hairpin lace headband supplies bulky weight yarn not much perhaps 15 yards hairpin lace loom crochet hook of choice i used h 8 yarn shown schachenmayr toy bulky weight headband gauge is 10 20 if both sides counted loops = 4 slightly stretched set loom to about 1 3/4 distance or preferred distance between the pins make a slipknot and slide on the right side leg of the loom following directions in the stitch diva tutorials begin making loops always turning loom the same direction when you get the number of loops desired bind off and slip off loom taking care to secure yarn so it doesn t pull loops off run enough single crochets to give your headband the desired length in my case i made 98 loops and ran about 5 single_crochet s to connect to the other side this headband is fairly stretchy so try it on before you weave your ends in i did no finishing on the loops in the bulky yarn as you can see it holds the shape pretty well and doesn t need as much finishing as a wider width strip in a lighter yarn i like a 23 headband fairly loose on me tight headbands give me headaches which may be looser than you would want remember to make more loops easy to pull out rather than too few before you try it on enjoy stitchdiva com has great tutorials for hairpin lace http //www stitchdiva com/custom aspx id=73 they have beautiful looms too i am not affiliated with them but i am a big fan of their patterns
